page.title: 11FARMING - WICK FARM
page.content: Our farm is 76 acres for which we pay approx. Â£60 per acre annually to WCC. We have a dairy herd of 60 Friesian cows and a Charolais bull. Each cow produces about 5,800 litres of milk per year; the milk is collected daily by tanker. The calves are all sold at Chippenham Market at 10-14 days of age. We also keep about 15 pigs. The sows farrow twice a year with an average of 11 piglets per litter. These piglets are weaned from the sow at 5 weeks and then sold at market at about 12 weeks old. As a self-employed farmer, my husband works extremely hard - he gets up at 5.30am and is rarely finished before 8 in the evening, but he thoroughly enjoys his work. I do all the farm accounts, VAT and paperwork, and help on the farm where necessary.
